author: Corky Emrick
title: Five-set rally
text: Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 12:12 AM Sturgis trailed 2-1 to Allegan Thursday night and rallied back to beat the Tigers 3-2. The win was the Lady Trojans first conference win. “The senior leadership stepped up their games with a refusal to lose tonight and demonstrating that both on the front line and back row,” coach Jacki Veldkamp said. Sturgis lost the opening game 25-23, then took the second game 25-18. Allegan took game three 25-21. Sturgis won the fourth game 25-21 and took the final game 15-10. “The Trojans came out looking for a win tonight. Sophomores Hannah Bronstetter and Brianna Wheeler both had an amazing night and really showed the team and the town what they are capable of this year and the years to follow,” Veldkamp said. Bronstetter had three digs and 13 kills, Wheeler added 30 assists, 15 digs and nine blocks. Paige Andrews had four kills, eight blocks and four digs, Morgan Pueschel added one assist, Paige Robinson had 16 kills and nine blocks, Harmony Groves had two kills and 21 digs and Camryn hamlin added seven kills and six blocks. Cloie LaRoy had three kills, Nikki Nelson added eight blocks and Lexi Mazzoni and Kayla Nichols both recorded five digs. Pittsford 25, 25, 25, 25 Burr Oak 11, 11, 12, 13 Burr Oak’s volleyball team was dropped both ends of a doubleheader with division leading Pittsford Thursday night. In the first match the Lady Bobcats fell 25-11, 25-11 and in the second lost 25-12, 25-13. “It did not mater what I tried tonight, nothing worked,” coach Kris Owens said. “Pittsford is first in our division for a reason. They are very good. My girls got down in the first set and never recovered. Brooke Cooper had 10 digs, eight assists, four kills and one ace, Lexi Habib added 12 digs, two kills, one assist and one ace and Chelsey Boyd had nine digs, one kill and two aces. Sydney Owens had four kills, four digs and one ace, Abby Greene added 10 digs, three kills and one ace, Zoe Lewis had five digs and one kill, Hannah Root recorded one dig, Ivy Eels had three kills and three digs and Kaitlin Cooper added three digs. Paw Paw 25, 25, 25 Three Rivers 12, 10, 23 Three Rivers lost a big weapon in the first set and ended up being swept by Paw Paw 25-12, 25-10, 25-23 Thursday night. Coach Erik Kore said the the Lady Wildcats lost setter/outside hitter Jordan VanOss rolled an ankle. “Jordan’s injury set us back, but we battled really hard in the third set,” Kore said. “I am proud of this teams performance.” Page 2 of 2 - Tessa Hawkins had 21 digs and Megan Southland had eight kills.
